title: PM-KISAN Samman Nidhi
description: Provides ₹6,000 per year in three installments to small and marginal farmers.
eligibility: All small and marginal farmers with cultivable land.
benefits: ₹2,000 every four months via Direct Benefit Transfer.
howToApply: Apply online through https://pmkisan.gov.in or visit Common Service Centers.

title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
description: Crop insurance for farmers to protect against crop failure due to natural calamities.
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas.
benefits: Insurance coverage for crop loss, premium subsidized by the government.
howToApply: Apply via banks, insurance providers, or the PMFBY portal.

title: Kisan Credit Card Scheme
description: Timely credit to farmers for cultivation and allied activities at subsidized interest.
eligibility: All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers.
benefits: Short-term loans up to ₹3 lakh at 4% interest (with prompt repayment).
howToApply: Apply through any bank branch or via online banking portals.

description: Description for Agriculture Scheme 4.
eligibility: Eligibility details for Agriculture Scheme 4.
benefits: Benefits provided under Agriculture Scheme 4.
howToApply: Application process for Agriculture Scheme 4.

title: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
description: Provides health insurance coverage up to ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
eligibility: Economically vulnerable families identified through SECC 2011.
benefits: Cashless and paperless access to services for beneficiaries at public and empanelled private hospitals.
howToApply: Check eligibility on the PM-JAY portal or visit nearest hospital/CSC.

title: PM Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (AB-HIM)
description: Strengthens health infrastructure by developing critical care and diagnostic facilities.
eligibility: Public health institutions and citizens in rural/urban areas.
benefits: Infrastructure development, lab networks, and critical care services.
howToApply: Implemented by government health departments; no individual application needed.

title: Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY)
description: Establishes AIIMS-like institutions and upgrades government medical colleges.
eligibility: Medical institutions and patients benefiting from upgraded infrastructure.
benefits: Better medical education and patient services.
howToApply: Handled at institutional/government level.

title: Health Scheme 4
description: Description for Health Scheme 4.
eligibility: Eligibility criteria for Health Scheme 4.
benefits: Benefits provided under Health Scheme 4.
howToApply: Application process for Health Scheme 4.

description: Description for Health Scheme 5.
eligibility: Eligibility criteria for Health Scheme 5.
benefits: Benefits provided under Health Scheme 5.

eligibility: Eligibility criteria for Health Scheme 20.

title: Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan
description: Integrated scheme for school education from pre-school to class 12, ensuring inclusive and equitable quality education.
eligibility: All students enrolled in government and government-aided schools.
benefits: Funds for textbooks, uniforms, inclusive education, ICT, teacher training, and infrastructure.
howToApply: Automatically available to enrolled students. Implemented through state governments.

title: PM SHRI (PM Schools for Rising India)
description: Model schools that showcase all components of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.
eligibility: Schools selected based on nominations from state/UT governments.
benefits: Smart classrooms, modern infrastructure, experiential learning resources.
howToApply: Schools are selected by the Ministry of Education via state nominations.

title: National Scholarship Portal (NSP)
description: A one-stop portal for multiple scholarships from the central and state governments.
eligibility: SC/ST/OBC/Minority/EWS students across India meeting scheme-specific criteria.
benefits: Financial aid via bank transfer for pre-matric, post-matric, and merit-based scholarships.
howToApply: Apply at https://scholarships.gov.in during the application window.

title: PM Young Achievers Scholarship Award Scheme for Vibrant India (PM-YASASVI)
description: Scholarship for students in OBC, EBC, and DNT categories for class 9 and 11.
eligibility: Students in classes 9 and 11 belonging to OBC/EBC/DNT categories with family income below ₹2.5 lakh.
benefits: Scholarship of ₹75,000 to ₹1.25 lakh per year depending on class.
howToApply: Apply via NTA portal: https://yet.nta.ac.in

title: Mid-Day Meal Scheme
description: Nutritional support through free cooked meals to children in government and aided schools.
eligibility: All students in classes 1 to 8 in government, local body, and government-aided schools.
benefits: Free lunch on school days to improve enrollment, retention, and nutrition.
howToApply: No application needed. Automatically provided in schools.

title: PM e-Vidya Programme
description: A comprehensive initiative for digital education under Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan.
eligibility: Students and teachers in school and higher education institutions.
benefits: Digital learning via DIKSHA, SWAYAM, Swayam Prabha TV channels, and radio podcasts.
howToApply: Access freely through [diksha.gov.in](https://diksha.gov.in) or PM eVIDYA platforms.

title: STARS Project
description: Supported by the World Bank to improve quality of school education and governance in six Indian states.
eligibility: States of Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Rajasthan.
benefits: Improved assessment, governance, and teacher training systems.
howToApply: Implemented by State Project Directorates; not for individual application.

title: SWAYAM - Study Webs of Active-Learning for Young Aspiring Minds
description: A platform for free online courses from Class 9 to postgraduate level.
eligibility: Any learner across India (students, professionals, teachers).
benefits: Access to over 2000 courses from institutions like IITs, IIMs, NPTEL.
howToApply: Enroll for free at [swayam.gov.in](https://swayam.gov.in).

title: National Mission on Education through ICT (NMEICT)
description: Promotes the use of ICT tools for quality education and e-content development.
eligibility: Students and faculty in higher education institutions.
benefits: Free access to learning materials, virtual labs, and digital classrooms.
howToApply: Available through partner portals like NPTEL, SWAYAM, e-Yantra.

title: INSPIRE Scholarships
description: Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research provides scholarships to top-performing students.
eligibility: Top 1% students in Class 12 board exams pursuing BSc/BS/Int. MSc/MS in natural sciences.
benefits: Scholarship of ₹80,000 per year for five years.
howToApply: Apply at [online-inspire.gov.in](https://online-inspire.gov.in).

title: PM e-Vidya Programme
description: A comprehensive initiative for digital education under Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan.
eligibility: Students and teachers in school and higher education institutions.
benefits: Digital learning via DIKSHA, SWAYAM, Swayam Prabha TV channels, and radio podcasts.
howToApply: Access freely through [diksha.gov.in](https://diksha.gov.in) or PM eVIDYA platforms.

title: STARS Project
description: Supported by the World Bank to improve quality of school education and governance in six Indian states.
eligibility: States of Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Rajasthan.
benefits: Improved assessment, governance, and teacher training systems.
howToApply: Implemented by State Project Directorates; not for individual application.

title: SWAYAM - Study Webs of Active-Learning for Young Aspiring Minds
description: A platform for free online courses from Class 9 to postgraduate level.
eligibility: Any learner across India (students, professionals, teachers).
benefits: Access to over 2000 courses from institutions like IITs, IIMs, NPTEL.
howToApply: Enroll for free at [swayam.gov.in](https://swayam.gov.in).

title: National Mission on Education through ICT (NMEICT)
description: Promotes the use of ICT tools for quality education and e-content development.
eligibility: Students and faculty in higher education institutions.
benefits: Free access to learning materials, virtual labs, and digital classrooms.
howToApply: Available through partner portals like NPTEL, SWAYAM, e-Yantra.

title: INSPIRE Scholarships
description: Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research provides scholarships to top-performing students.
eligibility: Top 1% students in Class 12 board exams pursuing BSc/BS/Int. MSc/MS in natural sciences.
benefits: Scholarship of ₹80,000 per year for five years.
howToApply: Apply at [online-inspire.gov.in](https://online-inspire.gov.in).

title: National Apprenticeship Promotion Scheme (NAPS)
description: Encourages youth skill development through apprenticeships by offering financial incentives to employers.
eligibility: Youth aged 14+ who have completed at least Class 5, and are not in full-time education.
benefits: Stipend support and certification after completion of training.
howToApply: Register on the apprenticeship portal: https://apprenticeshipindia.gov.in.

title: PM YUVA Yojana
description: Aims to promote entrepreneurship among youth through education, training, and support.
eligibility: Youth between 18–35 years; special focus on SC/ST/women/disabled.
benefits: Entrepreneurship training, mentoring, and support.
howToApply: Apply via the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship portal.

title: UDAAN Scheme for Girl Students
description: Supports girl students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds to pursue engineering and tech education.
eligibility: Girl students in Class 11 from CBSE schools with annual family income < ₹6 lakh.
benefits: Free online resources, tablets, mentoring, and financial support.
howToApply: Apply through CBSE portal during the application window.

title: National Initiative for School Heads' and Teachers' Holistic Advancement (NISHTHA)
description: A capacity building program for 'Improving Quality of School Education through Integrated Teacher Training'.
eligibility: All school heads and teachers at the elementary level in government and aided schools.
benefits: Online/offline training modules with certification and incentives.
howToApply: Access via DIKSHA portal or state education portals.

title: National Fellowship for SC Students
description: Fellowships for SC students pursuing MPhil and PhD programs.
eligibility: SC students enrolled in full-time MPhil/PhD courses with annual income < ₹6 lakh.
benefits: Monthly fellowship + contingency + HRA.
howToApply: Apply online through the UGC portal.

title: IMPRINT India
description: IMPRINT (Impacting Research Innovation and Technology) is a joint initiative of MHRD and DST to fund research in higher education.
eligibility: Faculty and researchers of centrally funded institutions (IITs, IISERs, NITs, etc.)
benefits: Funding support for research projects in engineering and social sciences.
howToApply: Submit project proposals through the official IMPRINT portal.

title: National Supercomputing Mission (NSM)
description: Develops India's capacity in high-performance computing (HPC) for scientific research and academic institutions.
eligibility: Academic and research institutions with HPC-related projects.
benefits: Access to supercomputing infrastructure, training, and research grants.
howToApply: Institutions must apply via NSM implementation agencies like C-DAC or IITs.

title: National Digital Education Architecture (NDEAR)
description: An open digital infrastructure framework to support ed-tech innovations, launched under NEP 2020.
eligibility: Education departments, schools, ed-tech startups.
benefits: Interoperability, open standards, digital credentials.
howToApply: Not an individual scheme; implemented by MoE and states.

title: PM POSHAN Shakti Nirman
description: Renamed version of the Mid-Day Meal scheme aimed at enhancing nutrition of school children.
eligibility: Children studying in Classes 1 to 8 in government and aided schools.
benefits: Hot cooked meals with improved nutrition standards.
howToApply: No application needed; provided through schools.

title: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS)
description: Supports meritorious students from economically weaker sections to prevent dropouts after Class 8.
eligibility: Students of Class 9 with annual family income < ₹3.5 lakh, who scored ≥55% in Class 8.
benefits: ₹12,000 scholarship per year from Class 9 to 12.
howToApply: Apply through NSP (https://scholarships.gov.in) using school recommendation.

title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban (PMAY-U)
description: Aims to provide affordable housing to urban poor by 2022 through slum redevelopment, credit-linked subsidy, and beneficiary-led construction.
eligibility: EWS, LIG, and MIG households not owning a pucca house anywhere in India.
benefits: Interest subsidy up to ₹2.67 lakh on home loans under CLSS component.
howToApply: Apply online via [pmaymis.gov.in](https://pmaymis.gov.in) or visit your nearest CSC.

title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G)
description: Provides financial assistance for construction of pucca houses to rural poor households.
eligibility: Households living in kutcha or dilapidated houses in rural areas, as per SECC 2011 data.
benefits: Financial support up to ₹1.2–1.3 lakh depending on location, plus MGNREGA and toilet assistance.
howToApply: Apply through Gram Panchayat or local development officer.

title: Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS)
description: Provides interest subsidies on home loans for the purchase, construction, or extension of houses.
eligibility: EWS, LIG, MIG-I and MIG-II families with annual incomes up to ₹18 lakh.
benefits: Interest subsidy between 3% and 6.5% on loan amounts up to ₹12 lakh.
howToApply: Contact any PMAY-registered bank or housing finance company.

title: Affordable Rental Housing Complexes (ARHC)
description: Rental housing for migrant workers and urban poor under public-private partnerships.
eligibility: Migrant workers, informal sector workers, urban poor.
benefits: Affordable rental housing with basic amenities in urban areas.
howToApply: Contact Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) or private ARHC operators in your area.

title: Global Housing Technology Challenge - India (GHTC-India)
description: Promotes innovative, fast, and cost-effective housing construction technologies.
eligibility: Construction agencies, developers, state housing boards.
benefits: Tech validation, funding support for pilot projects, and knowledge exchange.
howToApply: Submit proposals via [ghtc-india.gov.in](https://ghtc-india.gov.in).

title: Light House Projects (LHPs)
description: Part of GHTC-India, these projects demonstrate innovative construction technologies for affordable housing.
eligibility: Urban local bodies and state housing authorities implementing housing projects.
benefits: Support for replicable housing models with fast, sustainable technologies.
howToApply: Implemented through MoHUA and state governments. No direct application needed.

title: Beneficiary Led Construction (BLC)
description: Sub-component of PMAY-U for individuals to construct or enhance their existing houses.
eligibility: EWS families with legal land title and no pucca house.
benefits: ₹1.5 lakh assistance for house construction/improvement.
howToApply: Apply via ULB or online PMAY portal.

title: In-Situ Slum Redevelopment (ISSR)
description: Redevelopment of slums using land as a resource to provide pucca houses to eligible slum dwellers.
eligibility: Urban slum dwellers without pucca houses, listed in local survey records.
benefits: Free housing units with infrastructure and tenure security.
howToApply: Facilitated by ULBs and implementing agencies.

title: Affordable Housing Fund (AHF)
description: Established in National Housing Bank to boost financing for affordable housing.
eligibility: Banks and housing finance institutions lending to affordable housing segment.
benefits: Low-cost long-term funding to institutions for affordable housing loans.
howToApply: Institutions must apply to National Housing Bank.

title: National Urban Housing Fund (NUHF)
description: Set up by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs to support urban housing programs.
eligibility: State/UT governments and housing boards implementing PMAY-U.
benefits: Central assistance for implementing large-scale housing schemes.
howToApply: Accessed by eligible agencies through MoHUA.

title: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)
description: Maternity benefit program providing cash incentives to pregnant and lactating women for their first live birth.
eligibility: Pregnant women and lactating mothers aged 19+ for their first child.
benefits: ₹5,000 in 3 installments for nutrition and rest.
howToApply: Apply at Anganwadi Centres or online via [pmmvy-cas.nic.in](https://pmmvy-cas.nic.in).

title: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP)
description: National campaign to prevent female foeticide and promote girl child education and empowerment.
eligibility: Focuses on awareness for all citizens, especially in gender-critical districts.
benefits: Awareness drives, capacity building, community mobilization.
howToApply: Not an individual scheme. Implemented via district-level officers.

title: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY)
description: Provides LPG gas connections to women from BPL households to reduce indoor pollution.
eligibility: Women from BPL households listed in SECC data or eligible via state schemes.
benefits: Free LPG connection, first refill, and stove.
howToApply: Apply at nearest LPG distributor or via official PMUY portal.

title: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
description: Small deposit scheme for a girl child’s future education and marriage expenses.
eligibility: Parents/guardians of girl children below 10 years of age.
benefits: High interest savings account with tax exemption under 80C.
howToApply: Open account at any post office or authorized bank branch.

title: One Stop Centre Scheme (Sakhi Centres)
description: Provides integrated support and assistance to women affected by violence under one roof.
eligibility: Any woman affected by violence irrespective of age, caste, class or religion.
benefits: 24x7 emergency response, legal aid, psychological counseling, shelter.
howToApply: Visit nearest One Stop Centre (OSC) or call Women Helpline 181.

title: Women Helpline Scheme (181)
description: 24x7 toll-free helpline (181) to support women in distress, offering emergency and referral services.
eligibility: Any woman in distress due to violence, harassment, or emergency situations.
benefits: Emergency support, police referral, medical and legal aid, emotional support.
howToApply: Call 181 from any mobile or landline phone.

title: Mahila Shakti Kendra (MSK)
description: Empowers rural women through community participation and local resource centers.
eligibility: Women aged 18 and above, especially from rural and marginalized areas.
benefits: Skill development, digital literacy, employment support, legal guidance.
howToApply: Visit the nearest Mahila Shakti Kendra or contact your district WCD office.

title: Working Women Hostel Scheme
description: Provides safe and affordable housing for working women away from their home.
eligibility: Working women with income below ₹50,000/month in metros (₹35,000 elsewhere); widows, single mothers, trainees also eligible.
benefits: Subsidized hostel accommodation with day-care facilities.
howToApply: Apply through the warden at listed hostels or via employer tie-up.

title: POSHAN Abhiyaan (National Nutrition Mission)
description: Aims to improve nutritional outcomes for children, pregnant women, and lactating mothers.
eligibility: Children under 6, pregnant women, lactating mothers, and adolescent girls.
benefits: Growth monitoring, dietary advice, supplementary nutrition, anemia control.
howToApply: Access through Anganwadi centers under Ministry of Women & Child Development.

title: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)
description: Comprehensive scheme for early childhood care and nutrition through Anganwadi centers.
eligibility: Children below 6 years, pregnant and lactating women.
benefits: Supplementary nutrition, preschool education, health checkups, immunization.
howToApply: Enroll at nearest Anganwadi center in your locality.

title: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY)
description: Provides micro-credit to small and micro enterprises through MUDRA loans under Shishu, Kishore, and Tarun categories.
eligibility: Non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises in manufacturing, trading, or service sector.
benefits: Loans up to ₹10 lakh without collateral under three categories: Shishu (up to ₹50K), Kishore (₹50K–₹5L), Tarun (₹5L–₹10L).
howToApply: Apply at banks, NBFCs, or online via Udyam portal or JanSamarth portal.

title: Stand Up India Scheme
description: Facilitates bank loans between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 crore to SC/ST and women entrepreneurs.
eligibility: SC/ST or woman entrepreneurs aged 18+ starting a greenfield enterprise.
benefits: Loans for manufacturing, trading, or services with relaxed collateral and margin requirements.
howToApply: Apply at designated branches or via [standupmitra.in](https://www.standupmitra.in).

title: Start-up India
description: Government initiative to support innovation and startups via funding, tax benefits, and incubation.
eligibility: Entities registered in India as private limited, LLP, or partnership under 10 years old and under ₹100 crore turnover.
benefits: Tax exemption, seed fund, DPIIT recognition, incubation support.
howToApply: Register at [startupindia.gov.in](https://www.startupindia.gov.in).

title: Make in India
description: Encourages companies to manufacture in India and incentivizes dedicated investments.
eligibility: Domestic and foreign investors, industries across 27 sectors.
benefits: Ease of doing business, subsidies, tax breaks, single-window clearance.
howToApply: Submit investment proposals via Invest India or state nodal agencies.

title: Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)
description: Provides financial assistance to set up micro-enterprises in non-farm sector.
eligibility: Individuals aged 18+, educational qualification 8th pass, institutions, SHGs, and cooperatives.
benefits: Subsidy of 15%–35% on project cost up to ₹25 lakh (manufacturing) or ₹10 lakh (services).
howToApply: Apply online via [kviconline.gov.in/pmegpeportal](https://kviconline.gov.in/pmegpeportal).

title: National Apprenticeship Promotion Scheme (NAPS)
description: Promotes apprenticeship training by providing stipend support to establishments and encouraging skill development.
eligibility: Any individual aged 14+ and employers registered on the Apprenticeship portal.
benefits: 25% of the stipend (up to ₹1,500/month) reimbursed to employers by the government.
howToApply: Register as apprentice or employer at [apprenticeshipindia.gov.in](https://www.apprenticeshipindia.gov.in).

title: National Career Service (NCS)
description: A one-stop platform offering job opportunities, career guidance, and skill development resources.
eligibility: Open to all Indian citizens seeking jobs or career support.
benefits: Job listings, career counseling, skill training, vocational guidance.
howToApply: Register at [ncs.gov.in](https://www.ncs.gov.in) and build a profile.

title: Atmanirbhar Bharat Rozgar Yojana (ABRY)
description: Incentivizes employers to create new employment opportunities during the COVID recovery period.
eligibility: Employers registered under EPFO hiring new employees with monthly wages up to ₹15,000.
benefits: EPF contribution (24%) paid by government for two years.
howToApply: Enroll new employees through the EPFO portal under ABRY scheme.

title: PM Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi)
description: Micro-credit scheme for street vendors to access working capital loans up to ₹10,000.
eligibility: Street vendors active as of March 24, 2020 with valid ID or LOR from ULB.
benefits: Collateral-free loan with interest subsidy and cashback incentives for digital payments.
howToApply: Apply online at [pmsvanidhi.mohua.gov.in](https://pmsvanidhi.mohua.gov.in) or via Common Service Centers.

title: National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM)
description: Empowers rural poor by promoting self-employment through SHGs and federations.
eligibility: Rural poor households identified by SECC and participating in SHGs.
benefits: Interest-free loans, training, and access to markets through SHG networks.
howToApply: Join a Self Help Group or contact the nearest block mission office.
